TopicTitle: [1.2.x] Aviator Arsenal - World War 2 aircraft weaponry (v1.3)

Articles.Content:
I have no idea. I just have BDArmory, which adds in a lot of missiles and three bombs, 4 30mm guns that I can think of, 2 20mm guns, one fifty cal, and two cannons, plus an explosive warhead, a weapons manager, a laser, a flight computer, and a missile guidance system.

Then delete your BDArmory folder, download and install the latest.

It's clear that you do not have the latest version, this mod was developed to use the latest and there are no guarantees it will work with any other version.
Oh. I haven't tested the guns yet. they might work...still, thank's for telling me! Imma make sure I have the newest version!

Oh man, it's been a long time since I last checked this thread and ball turrets? Yay! Coincidentally I just made a B-17 so that I could shoot it down with my fighters! It will look so much nicer with the turrets!

As you can see, lander cans don't quite cut it...

Oh man, it's been a long time since I last checked this thread and ball turrets? Yay! Coincidentally I just made a B-17 so that I could shoot it down with my fighters! It will look so much nicer with the turrets!

http://i.imgur.com/0aaRqy0.png

As you can see, lander cans don't quite cut it...

Yes, those lander cans look terrible

And the worst part, they can't actually shoot at anything.

If you mind sharing your craft, I will stick the turrets to it and share some pics :3

Guys, there are a lot of things coming for the next version, I don't think even half of it was disclosed, but it's mostly unexpected stuff.

I am not going to disclose more right now because I don't even know what was shown and what was not, so here is something you already have, but from another perspective:

Yes, every texture is high quality like that one, shame on you KSP for hiding all the details.
Ok I just got it uploaded to KerbalX, here is a link to the page: http://kerbalx.com/Andrewwang66/BD-B-17-G-Bombs. It does have a lot of modded parts though.

Then delete your BDArmory folder, download and install the latest.

It's clear that you do not have the latest version, this mod was developed to use the latest and there are no guarantees it will work with any other version.

Well, I got the latest version of it, and although I think I got everything from 8.3 out, it still causes Kraken attacks whenever I launch something, basically keeping me from playing. So for now I'm keeping the 8.3 until I figure out how to make 9.9.1 work. btw, the guns from your stuff don't work, which probably explains why NAS didn't work...If I can't get 9.9.1 to work, I may just have to deal with 8.3 or just quit BDArmory and go to skillful weapons and damage...any ideas on how to fix it? (I already posted the problem in the main BDArmory thread, no response yet.)

[quote name='Generalstarwars333']-snip-[/QUOTE]

BDA turrets changed a bit since 8.3, so there's bound to be some manner of wonk when trying to use this or NAS in 8.3. To give you an idea, trying to use an 8.3 gun in the current version of the plugin will result in the guns giving physics the finger, trying to run from the cursor, refusing to fire, and other oddities.

If you are unsure if you got everything out, just delete the BDArmory folder in your Gamedata, along with any other BDA addons (Never Enuff Dakka, PEW, Old School Turrets, Spanners Boomsticks, etc.)just to be safe. It would also be good to go through your modlist and double-checking everything (I mean [I]everything[/I]) is updated to the latest version of KSP. If one of the mods doesn't have a version for 1.0.5, check the last 2 or 3 pages of its thread to see if it still runs right in 1.0.5.

I've gotten rid of the pew and caracharoth aeronautics and aviator arsenal since I'd given up hope of 9.9.1 working and decided they were pointlessly using memory. IDK if 9.9.1 would work now, but I'm pretty content with 8.8.3 for the moment.

Oh, by the way, BDArmory is receiving some pull requests dedicated specially for this mod, and for making BAD-T more interesting.
